contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} '''Alexander Mitchell''', (13 April 1780 – 25 June 1868) was an [[Irish people|Irish]] [[engineer]] who from 1802 was [[blindness|blind]]. He is known as the [[inventor]] of the [[screw-pile lighthouse]]. He was a native of [[Dublin]], and received his formal education at [[Belfast Academy]] where he excelled in [[mathematics]]. Mitchell was a brickmaker in [[Belfast]] who invented machines used in that trade, and the [[Screwpile|screw-pile]] for which he gained some fame. The screw-pile was used for the erection of [[lighthouse]]s and other structures on mudbanks and shifting sands, and employed with great success all over the world from [[Portland, Maine|Portland]] breakwater to [[Bombay]] bridges. It was used for the construction of lighthouses on [[Maplin Sands]] in the [[Thames Estuary]] (the first light application, in 1838), at [[Morecambe Bay]] (the first completed, in 1839), and at [[Belfast Lough]] where his lighthouse was finished in July 1844. In 1848 he was elected member of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers]] and received the [[Telford Medal]] for a paper on his invention. In May 1851 he moved to [[Cobh]] to lay the foundation for that lighthouse; the success of these undertakings led to the use of his invention on the breakwater at [[Portland Harbour|Portland]], the viaduct and bridges on the [[Bombay, Baroda and Central India Railway]] and the whole system of Indian telegraphs. He was friendly with [[astronomer]] [[John Thomas Romney Robinson]], and [[mathematician]] [[George Boole]]. He died at [[Glen Devis]] near Belfast on 25 June 1868. ==External links== *[http://www.universityscience.ie/pages/scientists/sci_Alexander_Mitchell.php Profile of Alexander Mitchell], from the Irish Universities Science website{{Dead link|date=February 2011}} *[http://www.historyireland.com/volumes/volume14/issue3/features/?id=324 Belfast's blind engineer], from History Ireland. ==References== * {{cite journal|first=Alan J.|last=Lutenegger|title=Historical development of iron screw-pile foundations, 1836-1900|journal=International Journal for the History of Engineering & Technology|url=http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/maney/het/2011/00000081/00000001/art00005|publisher=[[Newcomen Society]]|volume=81|year=2011|pages=108–28|doi=10.1179/175812109X12547332391989}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2011}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Mitchell, Alexander | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 13 April 1780 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 25 June 1868 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mitchell, Alexander (engineer)}} [[Category:1780 births]] [[Category:1868 deaths]] [[Category:Irish engineers]] [[Category:Irish inventors]] [[Category:People from County Dublin]] [[Category:Lighthouse builders]] [[Category:People educated at the Belfast Royal Academy]] [[Category:Blind people from Ireland]] {{engineer-stub}}
